stinc.male.server.util.logging

Class TransferableMdc

  • java.lang.Object
    • stinc.male.server.util.logging.TransferableMdc
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, org.slf4j.spi.MDCAdapter

    @NotThreadSafe
public final class TransferableMdc
extends Object
implements org.slf4j.spi.MDCAdapter, Closeable
    An read-only MDCAdapter which allows to copy state of MDC between threads.

    This class is not thread-safe, but it correctly transfers MDC if used according the provided idiom.

    Usage examples.

    Correct: 

    
 final TransferableMdc mdc = TransferableMdc.current();
 executor.submit(() -> {
  try (@SuppressWarnings("unused") Mdc mdcTmp = mdc.apply()) {
      logger.info("This call can access contents of mdc via org.slf4j.MDC");
  }
  logger.info("This call can not access contents of mdc via org.slf4j.MDC");
 });
    Incorrect 1: 
    
 executor.submit(() -> {
  try (@SuppressWarnings("unused") Mdc mdcTmp = TransferableMdc.current().apply()) {
      logger.info("This call can access contents of mdc via org.slf4j.MDC");
  }
  logger.info("This call can not access contents of mdc via org.slf4j.MDC");
 });
    This is incorrect because this way we do not have access to the context data of the "parent" thread.

    Incorrect 2: 

    
 final TransferableMdc mdc = TransferableMdc.current();
 executor.submit(() -> {//task1
  try (TransferableMdc mdcTmp = mdc.apply()) {
      //...
  }
 });
 executor.submit(() -> {//task2
  try (TransferableMdc mdcTmp = mdc.apply()) {
      //...
  }
 });
    This is incorrect because task1 and task2 may be executed concurrently and hence methods apply() and close() may be executed concurrently, but these methods are not thread-safe. The simple way to fix the incorrect example is as follows: 
    
 final TransferableMdc mdc1 = TransferableMdc.current();
 executor.submit(() -> {//task1
  try (TransferableMdc mdcTmp = mdc1.apply()) {
      //...
  }
 });
 final TransferableMdc mdc2 = TransferableMdc.current();
 executor.submit(() -> {//task2
  try (TransferableMdc mdcTmp = mdc2.apply()) {
      //...
  }
 });

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TransferableMdc apply()
      Merges this TransferableMdc into the current Thread's MDC and retains original state of the current MDC.
      void clear() 
      void close()
      Restores current Thread's MDC to its state before apply() (this state was retained by apply()).

      Creates TransferableMdc which holds current thread's MDC context map.

      • current

        public static final TransferableMdc current()
        Creates TransferableMdc which holds current thread's MDC context map.
        Returns:
        New TransferableMdc which state is identical to the current thread's state of MDC.
